messages.content: Cade successfully executes a sneak attack on a goblin, while Cheba uses the Sanctuary spell to protect herself. The goblins become disoriented and one is knocked unconscious. The players have the advantage as it is now the goblins' turn.
After the goblins' failed attack and the successful actions by Cade and Cheba, it is now the players' turn again. They can choose their next actions against the disoriented goblins.
We the players get to roll our own dice correct?
Pick up where we left off please

Of course, it is the player's turn now. Cade, from his hidden position, has just successfully taken down one goblin. Meanwhile, Cheba has unleashed a burst of light with Thaumaturgy, disorienting the remaining two goblins. What are your next moves?
Cade will sneak attack one of the goblins that is blinded.

Absolutely, Cade can use this opportunity to try and sneak attack one of the disoriented goblins. With their senses still recovering from Cheba's Thaumaturgy spell, they won't see him coming. It's the perfect time for a strike.

Sure. The players' characters, Cade and Cheba, set up camp in the forest and plan a surprise attack on the goblins. After a loud noise compromises their position, Cheba casts a sanctuary spell, causing the goblins to hesitate in their attack. Cade capitalizes on this and lands a successful sneak attack on one of the goblins. This, followed by a flash of light from Cheba's Thaumaturgy spell, leaves the remaining goblins disoriented. With one goblin already down, Cade prepares for another sneak attack on the confused goblins.
Of course, you can roll your own attack. This will determine the outcome of Cade's sneak attack on one of the blinded goblins. Good luck!
